metadata.title: CVE-2017-12192 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The keyctl_read_key function in security/keys/keyctl.c in the KeyManagement subcomponent in the Linux kernel before 4.13.5 does not properlyconsider that a key may be possessed but negatively instantiated, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (OOPS and system crash) viaa crafted KEYCTL_READ operation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-4.13.0-17-lowlatency - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1078.83
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-azure - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1019-gcp - 5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-17.20').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1006.6').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.83').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
